item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, September 15, 2024 at 2:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Wordllama – Things you can do with the token embeddings of an LLM (220 points | 13 comments)
2. AT&T's Hobbit Microprocessor (2023) (45 points | 16 comments)
3. OpenSCAD: The Programmer's Solid 3D CAD Modeller (363 points | 120 comments)
4. The Disunity of Consciousness in Everyday Experience (11 points | discuss)
5. Lazarus Group laundered $200M from 25 crypto hacks to fiat (209 points | 128 comments)
6. Mastering Null Semantics: Translating SQL Expressions to OpenSearch DSL (24 points | 4 comments)
7. One in five genetics papers contains errors thanks to Microsoft Excel (2016) (311 points | 185 comments)
8. Logbookd – SQLite Backed Syslogd (27 points | 3 comments)
9. Powerful, Open-Source, Programmatic CAD (55 points | 9 comments)
10. Carma (YC W24) Is Hiring Software Engineers to Get Fleets Same-Day Auto Repair ( | hide)
11. Writing an OS in Rust (342 points | 40 comments)

17. We're not going to run out of new anatomy anytime soon (99 points | 51 comments)

19. Throwable tactical camera transmits 360° panoramic thermal images (3 points | discuss)
20. Making a rickroll laser: A parametric speaker (174 points | 48 comments)

22. Falsehoods programmers believe about TCP (251 points | 178 comments)
23. Founder Mode, hackers, and being bored by tech (284 points | 151 comments)
24. Warewoolf: A minimalist novel-writing system/rich text editor (65 points | 30 comments)
25. Nesting Allocators (2023) (87 points | 6 comments)
26. Show HN: Epitomē – A semantic search engine for ancient text (11 points | 4 comments)
27. Porting SBCL to the Nintendo Switch (394 points | 72 comments)
28. A Time Consuming Pitfall for 32-Bit Applications on AArch64 (44 points | 20 comments)
29. The Rise of Open Source Time Series Databases (117 points | 49 comments)
30. Installing Arch Linux on a Laptop (68 points | 104 comments)
